website_summaries.verdict: A durable handheld with storage from a reputable fitness brand.
pros: A zip pocket with reflective detailing offers plenty of space to store gels or keys
Bring along two on longer runs, and you’ll have just over a liter to quench your thirst
cons: A few runners noted that the bottle has a tendency to leak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for long runs!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to help me through marathon training. I was considering a hydration pack, a running belt, or a water bottle. This water bottle was the ultimate choice. Let me tell you...I LOVE it! It is super comfortable to hold throughout a run. It's the perfect amount of water and is not too heavy at all to carry. Plus, the pouch easily fits my endurance chews/car keys in...ultimately eliminating my need to wear a belt while running! It is not uncomfortable at all to hold on the runs, to be honest, I barely notice it during my runs. Definitely recommend, especially for long distance runners.
customer_reviews.author: Caity

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these for my husband and I to use during our half marathon training. I love how they strap onto your hand but they both leak a little while running. I'm going to order new tops and see if that fixes the problem. It's not bad enough to soak us but in cooler weather its enough to make my hand cold! The pocket is large enough to hold my iPhone 7 (with no case), license and debit card which I love because most of my running pants/shorts have no pockets. Even with the leaking I would recommend this hydration pack because the pros definitely outweigh the cons!
customer_reviews.author: StephanieCTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: I love this water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I love this water bottle! It holds my phone and a key (but beware that not all of the colors have the same size pouch - I'm glad that I read that in other reviews). I usually use a fuel belt when it's warm out, but being pregnant, this is no longer an option. I thought that holding a bottle would be really annoying, but it's pretty comfortable, and I don't mind it with this bottle. However, the water doesn't stay very cold (not that it does with a fuel belt).
customer_reviews.author: Cari R

customer_reviews.title: Great water bottle, but some small percentage seem to leak.
customer_reviews.text: Love this water bottle! It was one of those things that I didn't think I needed and/or wouldn't use, but use it every run. ONLY PROBLEM is that after 10-15 uses the cap would not seal properly and the bottle leaked all over the bag. Amazon replaced and so far the replacement has been solid!
customer_reviews.author: David Dorris

customer_reviews.title: Functional and great colors, too.
customer_reviews.text: Love the color options and the functionality of this water bottle. It does leak if the cap is not screwed on carefully, though. I also wish there was a spout cover option or lid, maybe silicone or some other material. Also, I don't recommend storing this water bottle in a bag while it's filled as it can leak everywhere if something pushes against it. This is why a water tight lid or cover would be great to manufacture, even as an accessory. Overall, great water bottle. Btw, the pouch on my water bottle does not carry my smartphone. I have a galaxy s7 edge. Not a problem for me, though, but thought shoppers should know.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Jadrich

customer_reviews.title: Leaky and too hard to get into holder
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this one star only because I like that you can see through the bottle and tell how much liquid you have left. That's about it. The holder design is terrible, though. Why not use elastic?!? There is a ribbon that doesn't even stretch, making it so hard to get the bottle in and out. And the ribbon around the bottle top actually gets in the way of it closing correctly, which I suspect is part of the leaky top problem because it could be breaking the seal where the gasket is. Who knows. But I hate this and will not order any again until they change the holder design.
customer_reviews.author: HummingbirdsTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Leaky BUT Nathan was SO helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Great bottle and pouch! Comfortable to hold while running. And, while it's tight, it fits my iPhone xs with a thick case. BUT no matter how I put the cap on, the bottle leaked :( So, I attempted to make a return. That's when Amazon advised calling Nathan directly. In a matter of minutes on the phone, Nathan said they were sending out a replacement bottle for free because mine was defective. While I am not happy about the leaky bottle and the trouble in having to fix the issue, I am very happy with Nathan's response! Will update my review if the second bottle is defective too. Update: Happy to report that the new bottle is NOT LEAKY!
customer_reviews.author: Slug

customer_reviews.title: Nice but one design flaw
customer_reviews.text: By nature, these water bottles and their holding pouches will get wet with rain and or sweat. No two ways about it. It is incredibly hard to take the bottle out in order to wash the holder. This could be fixed just by adding some velcro or another type of safety closure that can be easily undone to refill and to wash. Another thing: the bottle top (where one drinks from) is great but...SUPER hard to wash and dry. If you have even mild mold allergies you might want to buy a new top monthly.
customer_reviews.author: pam d

customer_reviews.title: Poor Construction - DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE WITH PHOTO: The bottle still leaks, even when only half full. What's worse is that now it has a tear where the strap meets the pocket. This is after only 6 months of use at about 3-4 times a week. Surely there are better options out there. Overall, I like this bottle. It's the perfect size for my hydration needs, fits firmly in my hand, and keeps water cool. However, I've noticed that when mostly full, the water seems to leak out and get the phone case wet. So far, it has not damaged my phone but I've started keeping the bottle half empty just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. F

customer_reviews.title: This one leaks, get a water bottle with the other top
customer_reviews.text: This product leaks. It is made for running and not having to hold, which is fine. The mouthpiece is made so you can squeeze and not have to suck to get water. During my runs, slight pressure just holding the bottle makes water come out, so my hand got very wet. I prefer the Nathan water bottle with the mouthpiece with pull/push top, that works just fine and no leaking.
customer_reviews.author: kellertwin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! I use it for half marathons
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time....just used it for a half marathon. The pouch fits my Samsung S7 edge (without the case), my keys and an energy gel or two. You'll need bluetooth headphones or a super super small phone to be able to plug in your headphones. Lately I just put my phone in my flipbelt and use the pouch for keys and chews. The bottle is great and doesn't leak at all. Had it for about a year and use it for those medium-length runs where I don't need my hydration pack backpack but I can't go without water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great All Around Handheld
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend who complained about old, leaking handhelds that didn't hold much and got warm. It is still only winter, but thus far it has held up for 2 hours in sub-freezing temps without freezing over and a couple of 20 mile runs just above freezing without chilling the hand. The only test left is to see how well it keeps water cool come summer. UPDATE (9/20/19) The handheld has worked great so far in all seasons. I've stolen it for my own runs enough that I went and bought my own.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I like this system much better than my old hydration belt. It holds my car keys and a couple of gels pretty easily but will not hold my Iphone 7 with the Otterbox Defender case. which is fine with me. I like the fact that I can just turn it up, squeeze the sides and the water flows out. Worked perfectly on my longer runs. Easy to carry, switch hands, has not leaked a drop of water during use. Great product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Goose

customer_reviews.title: Fits LG G4, but a little leaky
customer_reviews.text: Fits nicely in my hand, strap is secure so that I don't need to hold the bottle. The shape of the bottle is perfect for my hand, which wraps around it naturally. Water did leak out of the nozzle a bit while using it for the first time, but not even close enough to soak my hand like other reviewers have said. The zippered pouch is just large enough to hold my LG G4 if I take the case off of it, and has room for other items as well. I think this will work out well for me.
customer_reviews.author: kkgrandmarais

customer_reviews.title: It's o.k.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two. These are great. Light insulation, easy to grip, the pocket fits more than I expected. I however do not like the way the water squirts into your mouth when using. It seems to go against the way drinking is supposed to work. It jets into the back of your throat and isn't very easy to consume while moving. Best way I can describe it.
customer_reviews.author: Evianbackwards

customer_reviews.title: My go to water bottle for my runs!
customer_reviews.text: This has become my go to water bottle for runs. Max run would be 6miles. Otherwise would need more water. I've had this awhile. It's held up really well. Easily adjusts. Easy to sip without spilling while running which is great. This holds my original Pixel XL phone. I do believe the reviews are right in that some colors have a larger pouch. That's how I picked this one. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy R

customer_reviews.title: 1st one leaked, replacement works great
customer_reviews.text: 1st one I ordered leaked at the plastic molding seam, not where the cap screwed on. I returned it via Amazon, and bought a second one which works really well. I fill it half way with gatorade and freeze, then fill the rest when I go running. The pocket isn't lined or water-resistant, so just be careful not to soak your phone etc when filling up the bottle from a tap or water fountain.
customer_reviews.author: ice cube

customer_reviews.title: Although it did not leak, it doesn't stay cold.
customer_reviews.text: It fit in my hand very well, but about half-way through the race, my hands were very sweaty and I could not hold it properly. I ended up discarding it and using the water that was handed out. Very disappointed that it did not have an insulated cover, so that my sweaty hands could hold it.
customer_reviews.author: Constance E. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: The best, just, the best
customer_reviews.text: I am just not a vest hydration girl, so it is hand-helds for me. I tried about 8 different brands and styles, and this is the winner. It is very easy to drink out of the spout. The ergonomics of the grip are very good. The size is perfect for a 6-8 mile run without refill in normal weather. I clean it with mild bleach. The zip pocket holds all the stuff I need (snacks, $$, ID, key). I just love this water bottle. Note, that I also got the 20 oz, but found the drinking spout on that one harder to manage.
customer_reviews.author: Linda G. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Won't Fit Larger Smart Phones
customer_reviews.text: The bottle is good enough for my exercise needs, but I was hoping to get something to fit my Samsung Note 9. The zippered pocket will fit smaller smart phones, but not the new ones. If Nathan comes out with a flask that can fit larger models, I'll be happy to buy one
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy to carry but leaks
customer_reviews.text: It’s great in theory. Comfortable to carry. Has a punch to put gels, chews, keys, etc in it. And it holds a decent amount of water. The problem is mine leaks. Quite a bit. So the pouch (and you) often end up a bit wet and, if you use something in it, sticky. Also, the zipper is already a bit “sticky” after less than 3 months of use. If you don’t mind the leaks, go for it!
customer_reviews.author: T. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for long-runs during marathon training
customer_reviews.text: Very solid water bottle for long runs. Am able to hold my iPhone 6S, keys and multiple GUs in the pocket. I am 5'9'' and weight 155 lbs, and when I'm running with the bottle full of water, it does feel a bit heavy, but the adjustable strap is nice for making periodic adjustments. Love that you can turn the bottle upside down and water won't come out, must squeeze a bit which is nice. Very easy to squeeze and use. Would recommend this for marathon training - was an absolute necessity for my 16, 18 and 20 mile training long runs
customer_reviews.author: faridrunsTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect for my half marathon run.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect for my half marathon run. The night before the run, I filled the flask with water and put my gel pouches in the pocket. Throughout the race, I filled it with water at the different water stations (meaning I took the lid on and off a lot). No leaks (except for when I didn't screw the lid on right). Worked perfectly the entire time.
customer_reviews.author: Becca K

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I recently did a 10 mile and 18 mile walk (so, all day long) and used the Nathan SpeedDraw Plus Insulated Flask. I was able to refill the bottle easily. I sometimes drank from the opening rather than the spout. With lots of mileage, I would switch hands and sometimes carry it by the strap too...it worked really well for the activity. I have a Galaxy S7 Edge and used the Sprigs Armband instead for that, as it is larger than the pouch. The zippered pouch was used for ID, cash, lip balm, extra tissue, etc.. It is just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: debinger

customer_reviews.title: If you don't want your phone wet, don't buy!!
customer_reviews.text: The pocket gets soaked from condensation! Ruined my Nissan key fob!! Thank God I didn't have my phone in there, otherwise that would have been Ruined too! Also, doesn't fit Samsung S8 or Google Pixel 3 if using headphones (only enough space for phone itself). Throwing in trash!
customer_reviews.author: Krystal K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for shorter runs
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I only used for 1 week but no leaking yet. It serves it's purpose but if you are truly a hands-free runner, this may not be for you. While it's definitely better than carrying an actual bottle in your hand as you don't have to wrap your entire hand around it, it's still something IN YOUR HAND. Also the strap got a little warm for me. The intended use for me is 5 miles or less. 5-10 I'll use my hydration belt and for my marathon training long runs, I'll use my hydration vest.
customer_reviews.author: TMar Pas

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to carry, good size bottle, my phone fits in the pocket.  Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice hand held bottle, good quality construction & comfortable to carry without having to grip it. The high flow top works well. I like the hi-viz reflective accents on the strap and the bottle. The pocket is just big enough to hold my Samsung Galaxy s6 phone or several energy gels. I haven't tried using the bottle for longer runs yet to see how well the insulated bottle keeps my drink cool. This is exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A solid choice if you leave your phone behind...
customer_reviews.text: I use this just about every day. I have not had a leak or issue of that sort. I have the iPhone 7 Plus which will not even come close to fitting in the pocket but keys security fob ID and some cash some gel’s... No problem... Well-made. But if it’s hot you’ll need to add ice because the insulation does not keep the water cold very long...
customer_reviews.author: Rob Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bottle. Its great for short runs... at least for me. Its too big to carry for a long run and the water won't stay cold for long. My iphone 7 fits the bag...
customer_reviews.author: Laura Micheletti

customer_reviews.title: Great Company
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this is great, but like the other reviews it leaks. When the bottle is filled and you screw on the top, the top will leak if it is laid down, just holding it while running and while drinking from the bottle. It appears that the seal is not proper at the top. I’ve tried just loosely tightening it to gorilla tightening it and nothing stops it from leaking I’ll be reaching out to the manufacturer about how they will rectify this issue. I sent an email to Nathan Sports and they replied within 24 hours and will be sending a replacement product out at no cost.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I hate running while holding something but while Marathon training I have no choice. I’ve run with this twice now-the longest was 19 miles. I have no problem with leaking or it slipping around on my hand. It poured rain 8 miles of my run and my phone and car key stayed completely dry.
customer_reviews.author: NESW

customer_reviews.title: Best water bottle for running!
customer_reviews.text: Great size and awesome reflectivity! The bottle itself glows when reflecting along with the tabs and strips. Very comfortable to hold and easy to adjust on the fly. Only complaints are with the cap. Slightly irritating but tolerable. First, the shape of the cap makes it difficult to remove or secure with wet hands. Second, after drinking from the bottle, it takes a while for the bottle to return to the original shape, thus making your grip different for a few moments. Overall, best bottle I've ever had for running!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan L.

customer_reviews.title: Water stays colder longer
customer_reviews.text: I got this handheld b/c my Nathan 22oz did not keep my water cold and when I filled it with ice it froze my hand. This water bottle remains cold and fits nicely in my hand without causing my hand to get cold or to fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: azyet24

customer_reviews.title: Leaky bottle
customer_reviews.text: many months later, I’ve changed my review. The cap leaks terribly and has since I bought it. I took some time to adjust amount in the bottle thinking maybe there was too much pressure. While the case fits my iPhone 8, it will damage the phone because it leaks so much. My older version Nathan bottle was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Edmonds

customer_reviews.title: Valve failed straightaway.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! Used literally twice before the valve failed. So far no response from Nathan in regards to return. Without valve you literally douse yourself while running, unusable at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Jared L. Evans

customer_reviews.title: it still wasn't the greatest. Water will leak out of the nozzle while ...
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars because it already broke. 3 stars if it didn't break. The valve in the cap came out and I couldn't get it back in. Otherwise, it still wasn't the greatest. Water will leak out of the nozzle while you are running because it doesn't take much pressure. The cap pretty much sucks. On a good note, it was comfortable to hold and it kept water cold longer because it's insulated. Good for short distances in the heat. If the cap was better this would be a great water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: The lid doesn’t go on correctly and leaks water all over you.
customer_reviews.text: I love this water bottle the handle the storage. But what I hate is the top doesn’t screw on right and I have to spen at least 10 mins trying to get it so it doesn’t leak then I just give up and run with water leaking out of the top.
customer_reviews.author: mhays629

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this water bottle for a half marathon. I've been running races for a while, but realized that it was probably smart to actually carry water with me rather than rely on the stations throughout the race. This bottle is perfect: good size, comfortable on my hand, doesn't leak. Plus: my S7 in its otterbox fits INSIDE of the zip up pocket. Perfect! As other reviewers have said: look at the size of the zip pocket in pictures, because some are bigger than others. I run with this all the time now, even shorter runs!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Miegl

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase
customer_reviews.text: The cap leaked within 2 uses. The Allston valve inside the cap fell out. Nathan did not respond to my inquiries. Amazon was not helpful with my concerns. I'm very disappointed with both this product and Amazon's response to my issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Maria

customer_reviews.title: Fits and feels amazing when using it
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife. This is the 4th one she has. It fits right in your hand and feels good when running. She loves it. I use a small one because I don’t drink as much water as she does.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Spout defective
customer_reviews.text: I have other nathan products and really like them. I've used this a handful of times and like the size/insulation. I hand wash it after I use it. However, the spout has already broken (again, I've barely used it). Not sure what the deal is but it's a lot of money to not work so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: happymom

customer_reviews.title: Best handheld I've tried!
customer_reviews.text: A necessary item if you ever do runs for more than an hour or in the humid south during summer. Small, but fits my iPhone 10 and a bag of chews. Easy to sip out of when on the move too.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella W

customer_reviews.title: Bummer because the bottle is useless now!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this water bottle for less than 2 years and really haven’t used it that much, so I was surprised that it has broken already. Today, the valve popped out while my husband was on an 11-mile run and all the water spilled out in the first half mile. I can’t seem to get it back in. Bummer because the bottle is useless now!
customer_reviews.author: Evie M.

customer_reviews.title: Big, holds stuff, but a little leaky.
customer_reviews.text: This bottle leaks as soon as I start running- I'm not sure if it's coming out of the valve flaps, or the collar connection itself. On a longer run which is when I need to take along water and nutrition, I end up with pruny hands and an uncomfortable wetness which kind of stinks to deal with for an hour or two.
customer_reviews.author: N. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great for thirsty runners!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for runners. I am able to jog with the thermos in my hand. Be careful when you purchase to note that the cases around the thermos vary in size. This one is one of the larger cases. My phone barely fits when it is in the LifeProof case. Some of the smaller ones you won't be able to fit a phone at all.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Love the insulation
customer_reviews.text: I have another Nathan bottle but this one is larger and insulated. Love the insulation. Also, the outside pocket is bigger than my other bottle allowing me to store a little more fuel for my run. Love the speed draw top.
customer_reviews.author: cjb

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS EVERYTIME
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one since my last one (smaller version same brand) was starting to smell and get moldy. Literally have not been able to use this water bottle not even ONCE without it leaking everywhere. No matter how I try to screw the cap on, it always leaks from somewhere.... its nice to have water while I run but its not nice that it leaks all over the place... they seriously need to fix this I can't even believe they put it on the market knowing there was no way to prevent it from leaking...
customer_reviews.author: jFo

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this water bottle! It fits my hand well without constant readjusting. The pocket is big enough to carry gels, keys, money, and tissues. I have an iPhone 7 Plus in a protective cover, so it does not quite fit, but that is ok with me. I use a different product for it.
customer_reviews.author: Marathon Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Leaks bad, feels comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The water bottle is the perfect fit for my grip. Haven’t found another bottle that works even close. The trade of is that it leaks like it doesn’t even have a lid. It leaks so bad, I can’t even put my phone in the pocket. Which stinks because it fits my keys and my iPhone 7 with slim otter box. But the amount of water that leaks prevents the pocket from being useful.
customer_reviews.author: SLK

customer_reviews.title: I feel like it shouldn’t do that
customer_reviews.text: I use this every time I run now - total essential. HOWEVER, it leaks. I feel like it shouldn’t do that...I wonder f it is defective, but since I ordered from amazon I can’t deally communicate with the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: heidijohanna04

customer_reviews.title: nice quality
customer_reviews.text: it's comfortable to run with and has held up well. seems to be the perfect size too. i normally don't like to run with anything in my hands but this surprising doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mutz

customer_reviews.title: A daily user.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for daily running nearing 2 months (5km ~ 14km), no leaking whatsoever, and I like the fact that you can easily squeeze the water onto your face or mouth while running and the grip is secure although you may like to tighten it a bit when your hand/palm starting to sweat but this should not be a case at all, and you can rest your arm vertically without having to worry that the bottle will slipped off your hand. The only concern for me is that the future phones is getting bigger in sizes and may not fit in the pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Nice Size
customer_reviews.text: Great for a shorter run in hot weather. Seem like it will work will to carry keys and a few energy gels
customer_reviews.author: Andrea J. Fitch

customer_reviews.title: You need this.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never been the type to run and hydrate as I hate carrying anything. This bottle has changed the game for me. The pocket is large enough to carry my phoneX, chapstick, gels, etc. And it keeps my drink cool up to mile 13 or so! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kiersten M

customer_reviews.title: No free returns!!!
customer_reviews.text: Too large and heavy when full of water, hard to hold, which defeats the purpose. ALSO NO FREE RETURNS ON THIS!!!
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Handheld water bottle with a pouch for keys id, ...
customer_reviews.text: Handheld water bottle with a pouch for keys id, phone etc. Does not keep water cold, but it is very convenient for short walks, hikes, etc. I prefer a waist belt for longer jaunts.Some of the colors come with a smaller pouch than others, so look carefully at the description if you want to carry your phone.
customer_reviews.author: lyndaB

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: Hand grip is good. I use this bottle for electrolytes for my long runs. Basic design seems to have a problem. Bottle squirts the liquid out on it's own without any apparent reason. I used this for 5 long runs so far and everytime it ends up quirting liquid multiple times when bottle is filled up. Seems to stop doing this when liquid is 75% filled or lesser. Bought this branded item expecting quality. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sadashiva R Yelluru

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love the bottle - use it daily running and walking around , in the office - keeps everything cold. Somehow the grommet (for want of the correct word) in the cap dislodged itself/is broken and it leaks everywhere . I called the manufacturer - a real person answered after the first ring and they are sending me a replacement ! Very happy and amazed! Thank you for backing your product.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsty t.

customer_reviews.title: Go to running bottle
customer_reviews.text: This bottle is easy to hold, does not leak, and hold enough water for an hour and a half run. This is a great bottle for running, I like it better than my water belt.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: No stress on hands when in use.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this bottle. I normally don’t jog too far, but in the scorching heat I wanted to make sure to have water with me. This sucker fits my hand so snuggly that it doesn’t slip off even when I’m not gripping it, but magically it doesn’t mess with the circulation in my hand either. Very high quality. Easy to use. And the attached pocket fits my iPhone X.
customer_reviews.author: J Guyer

customer_reviews.title: Great for long runs.
customer_reviews.text: I use it when running 5 or more miles. I’m able to keep my car keys, a small snack, & lip stick in the cute pouch!
customer_reviews.author: joycelyn10

customer_reviews.title: Cap needs to be turned really tight
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use it during summer. Had trouble with the cap leaking initially and then realized I had to twist it really tight for it to not leak and had come in very handy since.
customer_reviews.author: shiva

customer_reviews.title: Def leaks a lot
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great product, but the fact that it leaks more water than I consume is a huge bummer. I have used this twice and both times...nothing but leaking. I do like the design of the holder and the fact that I don't have to grip the bottle, but this is essentially unusable.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: This is a cool little bottle and band duo but I had purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool little bottle and band duo but I had purchased it for a race and I actually ended up tossing it not even 15 mins in. It bounced and rubbed me in all the wrong ways. Distracted me from my run and that is not what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bottle leaks like crazy
customer_reviews.text: I wear a hydration pack when its hot, but bought this for shorter, cool-weather runs. I really wanted to like it, but the "speed" lid leaks like crazy. The ouch and my hands were soaked. I can't imagine taking this on a cold run wearing gloves.
customer_reviews.author: tu

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This bottle fit well on my hand, held my phone (iPhone 8 in a smaller case) and kept the water cold. Bonus that it was easy to clean too.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my long runs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my long runs! It took some getting used to as I've never run with water before so it definitely weighs down your hand but its very compact, looks great and functions well. The pocket is large enough for my phone, pepper spray, and keys. Great addition!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Skip it.
customer_reviews.text: Where do I start? Great idea, poor engineering? Got into my Ragnar run and got thirsty. Went into the event knowing there were no water stops so I bought this bottle. Great storage however the compartment is not waterproof. It shouldn't have to be waterproof however the bottle leaked so badly that by the time I needed a drink everything in the zippered compartment was soaked and I had no water and 4 more miles to run. Inexcusable. The seal was garbage and didn't retain water. Also really didn't have reflection at night like it suggests. Pricey bottle for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it leaked at first but then I figured out that ...
customer_reviews.text: it leaked at first but then I figured out that strap was in the way of tightening the top and now it works great
customer_reviews.author: ryan phillip

customer_reviews.title: Great for runs
customer_reviews.text: Love taking this on my runs for 5 miles or less. I personally need something more for longer runs than that which I bought a hydration back pack from Nathan for. If you have somewhere to refill it you could use it for longer runs though.
customer_reviews.author: C. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere not a good product. Difficult to clean and it has to be cleaned horrible chemical odor.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible plastic odor. To small capacity check your dimensions. This isn't going to keep you hydrated on a long run. Even if I did use it water would taste like plastic I guess, not sure what the manufactured odor is.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great product and storage
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easily adjusts and perfect storage for my iPhone X
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Yehuda Masjedi

customer_reviews.title: No more frozen water during my winter marathon training!
customer_reviews.text: I am a long distance runner who does 2 marathons a year. So, this winter in particular I was so tired of my water freezing while I ran. I have tried adding a little salt to my water, but even that wasn't enough this winter. Once I got my Nathan SpeedDraw I was fine! My water no longer froze and I could avoid taking my gels without water! Wahoo! Thank you for making such a great product! I am looking forward to trying it out in the summer too. Cold water in the summer is the best!
customer_reviews.author: AGT

customer_reviews.text: I prefer the Velcro tighteners on these bottles, but this one works fine. These bottles are my go to.
customer_reviews.author: Mal

customer_reviews.title: Love!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough about this bottle! Besides the obvious reasons (leak proof, no cap, easy to hold, insulated, holds my cell phone perfectly...) it’s just a genius idea and it makes running so much easier!! Love this bottle so much!!
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect!! I have been a runner for about ...
customer_reviews.text: Just perfect!! I have been a runner for about 4 years and i have made my way thru several hand-held water bottles. I bought this particular bottle because of the larger pocket and i love the fact that i don't have to open the lid to actually get a drink...you just squeeze and go! I also really like that it is insulated which keeps your water cold longer and prevents the bottle from sweating. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alli Rhoades

customer_reviews.title: Useful Product!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this! I go for walks for 1 1/2 hrs and this has been extremely useful. It keeps my water ice cold in hot weather during the whole time. It has a convenient pocket that fits an iPhone X with no problem. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: AMH

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like crazy
customer_reviews.text: This bottle leaks like crazy even when I fill it only halfway to reduce the leaking. I would not purchase this if I could do it again. Don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MNPT

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable to hold
customer_reviews.text: This product does the job and well but feels awkward in my hand. Perfect for shorter runs.
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Simple, easy to remove the bag and wash. Its light weight, no leaks. Make sure to place the cap on correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: I normally don't like running with anything in my hands
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't like running with anything in my hands.....but this....you don't even know it's there! It hangs on for you. Bottle is super easy to clean, does not leak when you are running and super super easy to drink from even when running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Good size for those longer hot summer runs. The insulation keeps from freezing you hand off if you’re an ice-water type guy/gal
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle
customer_reviews.text: Love this bottle. This is my second Nathan speed draw. These bottles are Easy to hold and carry while running. The pocket is big enough to fit my iPhone 11 (without a phone case on), ID, and a GU packet.
customer_reviews.author: Ria

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave home without this if you are a runner!
customer_reviews.text: Never leave home without this every morning I run. Holds my ID, car keys, energy gummies. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: michelle king

customer_reviews.title: ... used this water bottle 4 times and it leaks like crazy. It's horrible
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this water bottle 4 times and it leaks like crazy. It's horrible. What a shame for something that cost $35. Don't waste your money. I wish I could return it and get something useful but it's too late.
customer_reviews.author: S. Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: I now use this more than my hydration pack when ...
customer_reviews.text: I now use this more than my hydration pack when there are a lot of aid stations at a run. I am able to keep 2-3 gels in the pocket, and the insulation on the bottle keeps my hands from getting cold.
customer_reviews.author: texaskimmy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long runs
customer_reviews.text: The 18 oz volume is perfect for long runs, and the pocket holds my keys, iPhone 6S, a credit card and a packet of gu. The cap can be finicky, it leaks if you don't attach it properly, but just takes a couple tries to get it right.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: My go to for hydration
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for running - training & races. I don't like wearing hydration packs & belts. So this small size is perfect. I can hang it from my wrist as I run if I get tired of holding it (even though the hand strap is styled perfectly in a way that it doesn't even feel like your using much effort to hold it) especially on warmer days. The pouch is a perfect size to hold gels, my ID and keys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... been using this for my runs and it works great! This is the first flask i've purchased for ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for my runs and it works great! This is the first flask i've purchased for running so i can't vouch for keeping the drink cold.. I know when i take it for my 13 mile runs the drink does not stay cold for too long.. By the 5th mile the liquid is warm..
customer_reviews.author: N. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: This was such a great purchase! It doesn't leak and it has great ...
customer_reviews.text: This was such a great purchase! It doesn't leak and it has great insulation especially if you put ice in it. I threw a Nuun in it the last time I ran as well and it cleaned out just by putting more water in it. It's really comfortable and fits my small hands quite well but my boyfriend who is about 6'0" thought it was comfortable as well. It fits my Galaxy S6 without the phone case.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Morin

customer_reviews.title: Great for running
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for marathon. Does fit Samsung s7 if not carrying anything else. Otherwise great option for carrying mid run fuel. Rests on hand so do not have to worry about holding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bigger bottle
customer_reviews.text: No leaks love this bottle. If this is your fist time with a squeeze bottle then you should test it before running to get used to the amount of water you want from a drink. Also fell down twice at a trail race bottle is still working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Best part for me is my iPhone 6 in a defender case fits in the pocket.
customer_reviews.author: abbyeb

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to hold
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to hold, keeps my water colder than a regular bottle, nice size pouch for holding gels ect. The reason I didn't give it five stars if because the top where the water comes out is cheap and hard plastic! WATCH THOSE TEETH! i would like a rubber mouth piece so with all the movements of running and drinking if you make a wrong move you don't have to worry about busting your lip open. Overall I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: It leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this...especially for the price...but it has leaked since the first time I used it. I kept thinking I wasn't putting the top on securely, but no matter what I do, it leaks. Honestly, in the summer heat, my front of my shirt being wet isn't really a bad thing, but the product should not leak! I do love how it fits your hand and you really don't have to 'hold' it.
customer_reviews.author: Etta

customer_reviews.title: Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It works great. Stays in my hand well. Keeps water refreshing. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JMReece

customer_reviews.title: warm water is better than no water and my hand didn't clench from ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Witch the packet was large enough for my phone. I will say I wish it was more insulated. The water tends to be warm at the end of a 6 mile run. That said, warm water is better than no water and my hand didn't clench from gripping the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: JoshSonOfBob

customer_reviews.title: Just what you need
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great running water bottle - my only complaint is that it can leak BAD! If you don’t get the lid on right you will get water or power aid in my case all over the pouch and yourself. With that said - it fits a pack of my fuel and is super comfortable to run with in my hand!
customer_reviews.author: Leacy

customer_reviews.title: Hold my Samsung 7 edge, car key, and stinger chews
customer_reviews.text: Holds my phone, car key, and stinger chews! Perfect for running or taking to the gym. I am very satisfied with this purchase! Will never buy any other brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Youngmomma 84

customer_reviews.title: Solid handheld.
customer_reviews.text: Great handheld, lots of storage, and not too heavy. Difficult to put any ice into during a race but I have found this to be a minor issue. I do find it funny that the bottle with the large opening is not insulated and the insulated bottle has a small opening.
customer_reviews.author: Stormy Phillips

product_meta.title: Nathan SpeedDraw Plus Insulated Pack
product_meta.description: The most functional and comfortable insulated flask ever. Ergological shaped speed draw flask with fire and ice technology allows for the most natural grip possible and easy squeeze access to fluids.
feature_bullets: 18 oz/535 ml double wall insulated and Hi-Viz reflective speed draw Flask with race cap offers quick bursts of fluid and keeps liquids cooler longer
Fully Adjustable hand strap with thumbhole enables grip free running
Large expandable zippered pocket carries phone, keys, ID and other running essentials
Double-Walled construction keeps fluids cooler 20% longer than other insulated bottles
Integrated reflective fabric offers 360 degree reflectivity for visibility in low light conditions

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
